column3: Debian is at 5.3.2 - can someone test if that needs this?\n
I guess the upstream bug is that one: https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-43473.\nMaybe it's to early to remove it... will test on Debian and OSX with Qt<5.5...\n
Tested on stable debian (8.x, just downloaded and did a VM net install). I guess the bug was fixed in Qt5.4. and debian is still on 5.3.x.\nI guess we should keep the workaround another year.\n
Without the workaround, selecting a parent will result in partial check of the parent and all it's childs (which is a bug).

Yes that is the work around the bug is fixing, if it's still present the workaround can remain. Should we add a note that it's fixed in 5.4, and as such can be removed once all platforms have upgraded to it?\n
Yes. And I think we should add a link to the upstream bug in the comment.\n

I'd like to see the comment about removing updated and stay there (or moved after the link to Qt bug) - something like

```
Please remove this ugly fix, once fixed Qt is used in all relevant platforms.
```
Yes. We have discussed that on IRC and IMO it would look after we are overdoing the workaround.\nLet's just keep it and remove the WA after one or two years.\n
My reasoning was that gitian uses qt5.5, so we don't need it in the official releases. People that are using qt-5.3 or qt-5.4, still have it enabled.\n
